      • markResolvedSub

        public void markResolvedSub(MetaVariable con,
                   ConstraintNetwork metaValue)
        Description copied from class: MetaConstraint
        Method to mark a MetaVariable as solved. This method is called by the MetaConstraintSolver and must be implemented by the developer of the MetaConstraint.
        Specified by:
        markResolvedSub in class MetaConstraint
        Parameters:
        con - The MetaVariable that is to be considered solved by the given meta value.
        metaValue - The solving meta value.

      • draw

        public void draw(ConstraintNetwork network)
        Description copied from class: MetaConstraint
        Method to draw the metaCSP's constraint network according to the rationale of this MetaConstraint (e.g., for a resource, this could be the resource usage profile as it is determined by the given constraint network). This method must be implemented by the developer of the MetaConstraint.
        Specified by:
        draw in class MetaConstraint
        Parameters:
        network - The constraint network to draw.

      • isEquivalent

        public boolean isEquivalent(Constraint c)
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Method for assessing the "equivalence" between two constraints. This is not used for lookups nor comparisons (hence, it is not the equals method).
        Specified by:
        isEquivalent in class Constraint
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to compare against.
        Returns:
        true iff the two constraints are considered to be equivalent.
